intro: Osmolindsaea, commonly known as the ghost fern, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, translucent leaves that give it a ghostly appearance. The plant is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. Osmolindsaea species are typically found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and streamside areas. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
